displaytitle: An Architectural Capriccio: A Vast Forum with Sculptural Monuments
medium: Black ink and gray wash over black chalk
creditline: Museum purchase, Laura P. Hall Memorial Fund and Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund

makers.displaydate: 1715–1759; born Paris, France; died St. Petersburg, Russia; active in Paris, Rome, and St. Petersburg
makers.displaymaker: Louis-Joseph Le Lorrain, 1715–1759; born Paris, France; died St. Petersburg, Russia; active in Paris, Rome, and St. Petersburg

texts.textentryhtml: Private collection; auction, Tajan, Paris, December 20, 2006, lot 72; bought in; purchased by Hill-Stone Inc. after sale; sold to private collector; consigned to Hill-Stone Inc.; purchased by Princeton University Art Museum, 2022.

displaymaker: Louis-Joseph Le Lorrain, 1715–1759; born Paris, France; died St. Petersburg, Russia; active in Paris, Rome, and St. Petersburg
caption: Louis-Joseph Le Lorrain (1715–1759; born Paris, France; died St. Petersburg, Russia; active in Paris, Rome, and St. Petersburg), An Architectural Capriccio: A Vast Forum with Sculptural Monuments, possibly 1758–59. Black ink and gray wash over black chalk; 56.5 × 88.5 cm, 82.5 × 112.5 × 8 cm (frame). Museum purchase, Laura P. Hall Memorial Fund and Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (2022-88)
